moves.1. e4: Mistee is challenged to a game by Easy19 (wonder what his name means?) Mistee plays white and moves her normal e4.
moves.1... h6: Mr. 19 surprises Mistee with h6. That's never happened to her before. She wonders what's up with that?
moves.2. d4: Mistee continues with d4....trying to control the center as her old coach Brian and the great and handsome lebanese/canuk tuff taught her.
moves.2... a6: Another surprising move by Mr. 19. But Mistee loves the pattern of the pawns.
moves.3. Nf3: Mistee continues developing her pieces. Controlling space. Playing the center. Mistee remembers her coaching.
moves.3... e6: Now Mr. 19 is playing more normal for Mistee. Still a nice pawn pattern on the board.
moves.4. Bd3: Mistee moves out the King's bishop to prepare for castling. She is still remembering her coaching. So far so good.
moves.4... c5: Easy19 moves c5, more of what Mistee considers a "normal" move since it controls more of the center. Mistee has a feeling that Easy19 is going to beat her to death with his pawns.
moves.5. c3: Mistee moves c3 to add additional protection to the d4 pawn and to strengthen her pawn structure. Lined up pawns are pretty pawns.
moves.5... cxd4: Mr. 19 is destroying my lovely slanted pawn pattern.
moves.6. cxd4: Should I take Easy19's pawn with the knight or my pawn? I like my knight where it is so I take with my pawn. Now I see that he could possibly put me in check with his bishop destroying all hopes for castling. Where are my chess coaches when I need them?
moves.6... d5: Easy moves his pawn forward creating a nice pawn line.
moves.7. e5: Mistee moves her pawn forward...slowly advancing.....
moves.12. Bb2: Not sure what to do so I moved a bishop
moves.17. Bc3: Mistee trying to develop, but her options are slim.
moves.20. Qc2: Need to get the queen out
moves.21. Rd3: Running away. It's what I do best.
moves.25... Qd8: Not sure what Freddy was doing.
moves.26. Rdd1: moving the rook to safety and attempting to protect my knight
moves.26... Qxg5: But then losing the other knight.
moves.28... Qh2#:
I never saw that.

Walk the walk...more like stumble and crash!

:) :) :) Thank you, Freddy.
